ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Lichen Planus with otologic involvement
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient has a known diagnosis of lichen planus; hearing deterioration correlates with stopping anti-inflammatory medication; physician notes excessive tympanic membrane scarring.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Conductive hearing loss post-stapedectomy
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of bilateral stapedectomies for otosclerosis, though current fluctuations and scarring suggest inflammatory etiology (lichen planus) rather than prosthesis failure alone.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, configuration, and type of hearing loss given the reported deterioration.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess middle ear status and ear canal volume, particularly given the history of scarring and surgery.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic evaluation reveals bilateral conductive hearing loss, worse in the left ear, with a mixed component in the high frequencies for the right ear. Word recognition remains excellent bilaterally. Tympanometry is flat bilaterally, consistent with the reported excessive tympanic membrane scarring and lichen planus involvement.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate rising to mild conductive loss (250-1000 Hz), becoming mixed (2000-4000 Hz), sloping to profound. Left ear: Moderate conductive loss (250-4000 Hz), sloping to profound. Significant air-bone gaps bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: 33 dB HL (Right), 50 dB HL (Left), in agreement with PTA. WRS: 92% bilaterally at suprathreshold levels.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Flat tympanograms bilaterally. Right ear normal canal volume (0.80 mL); Left ear small canal volume (0.20 mL).

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already under care of an otologist; follow-up is scheduled to manage lichen planus and monitor ear health.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor stability of auditory sensitivity and proceed with hearing aid evaluation.
